name: Elizabeth Fleischmann-Aschheim
quote: I am going to make X-ray pictures. I am going to make them better than anyone else.
summary: Pioneering radiologist who was one of the first women to work with X-rays and established the first X-ray laboratory in San Francisco.
shortDescription: Elizabeth Fleischmann-Aschheim was one of the first women to work with X-rays, establishing the first X-ray laboratory in San Francisco in 1896. She became an expert in radiography and helped develop early X-ray technology for medical diagnosis. Her work laid the foundation for modern radiology and medical imaging.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in 1859 in California, Elizabeth showed an early interest in science and technology. She was educated in San Francisco and developed a fascination with the new field of electricity.
detailed_description.stem_journey: In 1896, after learning about Wilhelm RÃ¶ntgen's discovery of X-rays, Elizabeth became one of the first people in San Francisco to experiment with the new technology. She established the first X-ray laboratory in the city.
detailed_description.challenges: As a woman in the late 19th century, Elizabeth faced significant barriers in pursuing a career in science and medicine. She also worked with dangerous X-ray technology without proper protection.
detailed_description.achievements: Elizabeth became an expert in radiography and helped develop early X-ray technology for medical diagnosis. She established the first X-ray laboratory in San Francisco and trained others in the new technology.
detailed_description.legacy: Elizabeth's pioneering work in radiology helped establish the field of medical imaging. Her laboratory became a center for X-ray research and training in the early 20th century.
